author: Deccan
title: Excited for Bigg Boss
text:
Deccan Chronicle | Natasha Coutinho | October 11, 2015, 23.23 pm Digangana Suryavanshi Digangana Suryavanshi
Popular as Veera from the small screen, Digangana will be seen in Bigg Boss. The 17-year-old’s participation has been surprising. “People definitely didn’t expect me here. Just knowing that I’m 17 has shocked a lot of people. When I was approached, I knew that there are going to be a lot of arguments and fights in the house and I wondered if I will I be able to deal with all that at such a young age, but then I just decided to go for it.”
Rochelle Rao
Former Miss India and IPL anchor Rochelle Rao is entering the show with boyfriend Keith Sequira. She says, “People know me as an anchor. I want them to see the real me. Someone who really inspires me to do the show is my friend Gauhar. She was put in various situations but she was still herself and didn’t lose her dignity.”
Has she taken tips from any former contestants? “I spoke to Gauhar and Gautam Gulati,” she says.
Is having a boyfriend around a saving grace? “Yes I’m going in with my boyfriend and I know single people will try to come between us, but I have no fear. We are strong and will push each other to do better.”
Speaking about what she will miss about the most she says, “My Bible and coffee.”
Suyyash Rai
Suyyash Rai of Badtameez Dil fame will be entering the house with girlfriend Kishwer Merchant. Speaking about his participation he says, “It was all very sudden. I was busy with Badtameez Dil when I got a call from Bigg Boss. I’ve always been scared of the show. Spending three months with unknown people is a challenge. Luckily for me I’m doing the show with Kishwer.” So has he quit Badtameez Dil? “I’m blessed to have understanding producers. I gave them a 45 days notice and told them that I have another project. I asked them to give me break. They assured me that I could always return to the show.”
Yuvika Chaudhary
Bollywood starlet Yuvika Chaudhary too will be in the house. She says, “I’m a homely girl. I took this show up as a challenge. My only preparation is shopping for clothes, I didn’t think of anything else.” With couples on the show, as a single contestant does she feel threatened? “ The couples may have the advantage as they would have double the number of votes but then Bigg Boss may have something else in mind. You never know what they have planned.”
Has she taken tips from former contestants? “Yes, most people said be yourself. Few people said you should plan something but I prefer going with my gut instinct.”
